learning_outcomes.description: Apply advanaced knowledge and problem-solving skills in your area of specialisation (Organic Chemistry, Inorganic Chemistry, Physical/Materials Chemistry and Chemistry Education).
Utilise and adapt advanced knowledge of research techniques relevant to aspects of your research work.
Communicate advanced knowledge of research techniques relevant in your area of specialisation.

assessments.task_description:
Students will complete a 2hr (120min) exam, specific to their selected research stream (Organic Chemistry, Inorganic Chemistry, Physical/Materials Chemistry or Chemistry Education). This exam will be a mixture of written and short answer responses. This will be a closed book invigilated exam, covering lecture content delivered in Weeks 1-7 of the semester

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Completed answer booklets will be collected at the end of the Exam
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Students will complete a written assignment (maximum 3000 words) detailing an experimental technique relevant to your Honours research project. This report will include a brief literature review (2-3 papers) detailing the history, development, underlying mechanisms, uses, strengths and deficiencies, and future directions of your chosen technique.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may

appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit your Report through the course Turnitin submission point in Blackboard. Before submitting your assessment item to Turnitin please name your file in the following way. FAMILY NAME_GivenName_StudentID_CourseCode_AssignmentName For example: Bob Smith (ID: 54329876) would name his ABCD1234 essay 1 in the following way. SMITH_Bob_54329876_ABCD1234_Essay1
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture Series

Specific course content for the students chosen research stream (Organic Chemistry, Inorganic Chemistry, Physical/Materials Chemistry or Chemistry Education) will be delivered in the format of weekly 2 hour lectures and/or workshop sessions delivered during week 1-7 of the teaching semester.
